Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.name: basicGCDTimerCallback(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.abstract: Called periodically, as the GCDTimer repeats (or fires once). This is required.

Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.name: basicGCDTimerValid(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.abstract: This is called after the timer is initially valid (but before the first run). It is optional.

Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.name: basicGCDTimerWillBecomeInvalid(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.abstract: This is called just before the timer invalidates. It is optional.

Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.name: basicGCDTimerSuspend(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.abstract: This is called just before the timer invalidates. It is optional.

Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.name: basicGCDTimerResume(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.abstract: This is called when the timer resumes.

Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.name: RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate
Protocols/RVS_BasicGCDTimerDelegate.html.abstract: This is the basic callback protocol for the general-purpose GCD timer class. It has one simple required method, and two optional methods.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer/_State.html.name: _State
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer/_State.html.abstract: This is used to hold state flags for internal use.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: _onlyFireOnce
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This holds a Boolean that is true, if we are to only fire once (default is false, which means we repeat).

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: _timerVar
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This contains the actual dispatch timer object instance.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: _timer
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This dynamically initialized calculated property will return (or create and return) a basic GCD timer that (probably) repeats.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: _seppukku()
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This is called to completely invalidate the timer.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: timeIntervalInSeconds
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This is the time between fires, in seconds.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: leewayInMilliseconds
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This is how much leeway we give the timer, in milliseconds. It is ignored for onlyFireOnce.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: context
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This allows the delegate to add any context data to the instance,

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: queue
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This is the dispatch queue the timer will use.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: isWallTime
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: True, if we are to use the Apple Wall Clock time.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: deinit
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: We have to carefully dismantle this, as we can end up with crashes if we don’t clean up properly.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: resume()
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: If the timer is not currently running, we resume. If running, nothing happens.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: pause()
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: If the timer is currently running, we suspend. If not running, nothing happens.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.name: invalidate()
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html#/s:17RVS_.abstract: This completely nukes the timer. It resets the entire object to default.

Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html.name: RVS_BasicGCDTimer
Classes/RVS_BasicGCDTimer.html.abstract: This is a general-purpose GCD timer class.
